turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I have to say -- I'm speechless. No. I'm never speechless.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I'm a little embarrassed. I'm not used to losing control with such -- volume.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: And I'm not used to -- Marylin -- there's something I want to ask you.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: What is it Miles?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I want... I want to...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I want to be your -- your wife.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: No... That wasn't right. I want YOU to be MY wife.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Did you just propose to me?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yes. I am. What else could those words mean? I believe we belong together and we can make one another happy. And we should be happy because happiness is better than the alternative which is -- just jump in any old time, Marylin. You have more experience at this than I do.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yes? Yes, you do have more experience?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Yes, Miles. I accept.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Do you want me to sleep on it?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Do you want to sleep on it?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: No ma'am. I have been asleep all my life up to this moment. Marylin, will you marry me?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Yes. Again.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I don't have a ring!

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I have a watch.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Wasn't she the Judge at my divorce hearing?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yes. Short notice you know, but I think there's nice closure to it. Hello Judge Muson. A pleasure as always.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: No. Judge -- just a sec. But Marylin, if we sign it, I can't hope to benefit from the marriage.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Oh Miles!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What I mean is, your wealth is completely protected.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: But?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I want this to be a marriage based on love, trust and community property. That's all I've ever wanted.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I'm sorry. I'm squishing you. I'll move to the...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: No. Stay. I want you close to me. This couch is wrong. It's not a "married couch."

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Honey, I could sit...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: In fact, this is not a married house -- it's a bachelor pad.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Hardly. You have six bedrooms

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I know. But I've converted most of them into ridiculous "Guy" rooms -- a billiard room, a card room, a gym -- Honey, want you to go out, as soon as you feel up to it -- and buy married things. Woman things. Personalize it. Marylinize it. Make this your house.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Here's my card. Spend as much as you want. We get mileage.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Well, I suppose I could "girly" it up for you with a little Fortuny, and some passementerie --

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Good.  Are those foods?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Fabric and fringe.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Exactly. And then -- maybe -- not right away -- There's a room right off the bedroom -- It would be perfect for a nursery.  It's a walk in humidor right now -- but if I took out the refrigeration unit --

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Miles.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I think a nursery should be right off the master suite. My parents put mine in the guest house. Apparently they did have a Fisher Price intercom, but my mother turned it off when I was seven months old because I was so --

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Hello Marylin.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I have a surprise for you.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I bet.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: You don't like me?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I love you. I want to have your baby.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: What's wrong Miles? Did I spend too much?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Miles. I have a very good relationship with all the salesmen. I can return everything.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Can you Marylin? Can you return the trust? Can you return the hopes? The dreams? Can you just...  SEND IT ALL BACK FOR STORE CREDIT?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Miles? You're scaring me.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I'm sorry, Darling. I love it. It's chic and timeless and elegant and eclectic and. It's you, Marylin. It is YOU.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Well. Well. Well. Look who made bail!

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: May I come in?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I don't know. Maybe I should grab my mace. I'm a civil attorney. I have little experience with "the criminal mind."

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I'd just like to pick up a few of my things

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I don't believe you have "things."

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: On the contrary. We're married and we have no pre-nup, so a case could be made that everything in here is mine.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Comfy!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I want to nail you ass.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Are you threatening me, because I'm sure that's a violation of the terms of your bail.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I'm reporting you to the IRS.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: The IRS? They owe me. I'm expecting a refund.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I'm clean with the IRS. I've reported every dollar I've ever made. Try again, girlfriend.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I'm not talking about dollars, studmuffin. I'm talking about --

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: STUFF.  Got a light?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What kind of "stuff?"

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Arty Farty stuff.  Lithographs and pre Castro Cubans. Watches and mileage on private jets. Stuff, Miles. Stuff you get from grateful clients.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Those are gifts.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Salary. Unreported income.  By the way, what time IS it on Bellagio Road?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You can't prove anything.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I don't have to. That's what the IRS guys do. And they do it with great zeal. See, they work at these tortuous civil service jobs, and when five hundred dollar an hour boys like you take their trade out in luxury goodies, these saps feel.. well, they feel like saps. And they feel bitter and they feel vengeful and they feel WRATH.  What is this? A Romeo and Julieta?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You're out of your league, Marylin. Rexroth was a primate. I'm a professional.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I know. So am I, right? And so is Agent Wilson of the Internal Revenue Service. He's a dedicated, underpaid graduate of Southwestern University -- very tenacious, and never more so than when he's dealing with an unscrupulous colleague.  I think it's only fair to warn you: I'm going to file an action, Miles. And after a decent interval I plan to have Ruth seek an injunction that will forbid your approach within 500 feet of my house.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Meaning my house.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I believe the residence will be part of the settlement.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Did our marriage ever mean anything to you?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Drop the bogus forgery charge and I'll forget about your generous friends slash clients.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: That's blackmail.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: That's marriage.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Marylin?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Miles? Miles! Where have you been? I've been trying to get in touch.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You have to leave the house immediately!

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I will, Miles. I will leave. But Miles --

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: No buts. Now. Out.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Just listen to me. I'm sorry, Miles. It's true that my initial intention was to...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Please! Leave the house.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I fell in love Miles.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: So did I. Now pack up a few basics and --

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: You do? You do love me?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: It's a no go, Joe.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Marylin!

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: It's okay Joe.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Wait! He works for YOU?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Now. But first, he worked for you.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You were going to have this thug...?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Wait just a second there. You sent him here. You unearthed this pestilence.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Nonono. Marylin -- I'm your husband. I'd be entitled to Rex's money. No matter what happened to you.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: That's true.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Marylin. Run. I'll distract him.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I'm not leaving you. I took self defense

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Hello Marylin.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Hello Miles.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Hard to believe this is the way it will end up for us.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: It's not something I wanted either.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: But then -- I guess -- something inside me died when I realized that you'd hired a goon to kill me.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Yes. I know. It's exactly how I felt when I realized you'd hired the goon to kill...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You wounded me first, Marylin.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Your forgetting Rex Rexroth?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You're forgetting Howard Doyle?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Forgery? Fraud?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Income tax evasion?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Murder?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Murder!

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I don't see how we can ever find our way back from...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Pre-Castro.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Fine. They were created during a dictatorship.  What if something happened to you? What would I tell little Gus when he asked "what was my daddy like?"

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Sweet.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I thought so.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Rex. Get away from the door.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Look, Marylin, can't we have a civilized discussion about this?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: We are. And it's winding down.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: But Marylin, you know a divorce would ruin me right now. Everything I have -- everything we have -- is tied up in my business. The business is my entire life.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Are you forgetting about the Atcheson, Topeka and the Santa Fe?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Marylin?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Rex. Go away. I don't want to have to sic the dogs on you.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Dogs?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Hello, Rex.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Marylin.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Are you alright? You lost weight.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: My whole metabolism is -- off.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Do you need a Tagamet?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: You have some?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Have you been taking your digestive enzymes?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Sometimes I forget.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I'm sorry. Where were we?

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: We were about to request the primary residence, and thirty percent of the remaining assets.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I was devastated. Of course.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Thank you, Mrs. Rexroth.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Who's that?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Is this a lover?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Please!

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Forgery and Fraud?

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: You used his credit card.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: He told me to -- he said he wanted me to --

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Quite a little shopping spree. How do you spend six figures in less than six hours? Oh, never mind I've seen it before. I've seen everything.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Do you think he set me up? Do you think that was his intention?

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Like I know his intention? Or yours for that matter?  I should join Sam. I'm too old for this bullshit.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: He never even asked. He just assumed --

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: He was right, wasn't he?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: So. Now what?

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Now? Well, Marylin, now you cut a deal or find out how Jean Harris made it work for her.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: You want to come out to the beach house tomorrow?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I didn't know Barry had a beach house.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Neither did I until my lawyer found it -- quite a paper trail -- he had it in the dog's name.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: She's a legend. Didn't she do Kravis or a Pearlman? She definitely did a Factor.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: She did a Harriman.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Wow.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: In the words of my Private Investigator, we're going to nail his ass.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Miles Massey.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Of Massey Myerson?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Do you know him?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: By reputation. He got Ann Rumsey that cute little island of George's.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Who's she?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Now? She's a night manager at McDonalds.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: We do have a man for you.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Please. I'm not seeing anyone until this is over. One husband at a time.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I wish I had your discipline.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I don't know what his game is. He dismissed every one of Ruth's proposals. And Sarah, we weren't unreasonable.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Well what does he want?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I don't know. Ruth kept her cool, but I could tell she was surprised.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: He has a reputation for being tough.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Lilly's up.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Oh, God!

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Every week --

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I'm dying.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Anyway, even Rex seemed perplexed by his intransigence. If I didn't know better, I'd swear Massey had some personal investment in my ruination.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: So where are you now?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Well, if he continues to maintain this position -- we're in court.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Get this! He called and invited me to dinner.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: That stinks. They left you with absolutely nothing. It makes you wonder about the entire legal system. Like Rodney King.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: They bought her speech. If I was only in it for Rex's money, he shouldn't have to give me any.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Nothing specific, but I'll have my own place soon.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: So, Marylin. Is that what you said when you were a little girl?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Probably. Every woman in my life was divorced at least twice. What was I supposed to say. Anthropologist?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: You're not...

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: No. I'll see some blood before this is over, but it won't be mine.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Sarah Sorkin. Ramona Barcelona -- this is Miles Massey.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Hello Miles.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: But Marylin, without this, you're completely exposed.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I want to be exposed.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Is this Ming?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: It's not Ming. It's Tong.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I can't do this anymore. Let's get some lunch.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What about rugs? I thought we were stopping at Mansour?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: He's not what I expected. He's very -- he's so -- happy.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: But you're going through with it?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Yes, yes, it's just -- you know I've never been the first wife. Rex was married before me.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: Miles is different. He's still so idealistic.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Well, that's about to change big time.

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: He has no cynicism or anger. For once I'm not the repository of rage at some other woman.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Soon, you'll have your own rage!

turns.speaker: MARYLIN
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: -- is not a challenge. I need something I can sink my teeth into, professionally speaking.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: He would invite these girls home from the staple factory to our condominium in Palm Springs. He had a device he called the Intruder.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Wait. I know you.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: You're Miles Massey! You probably don't recognize me. The drugs made me put on weight and grow facial hair.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: You ruined my life you sonofabitch. Gimme those.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yes, I know Howard Doyle.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: He tricked you. With a phony wife and a fake pre-nup. Howard Doyle. He got you. You married Marylin, didn't you? You thought she had money. HA HA HA. Howard Doyle made you think that because of what you did to me. And to Marylin Rexroth. Yeah. I heard all about it. My brother Howard Doyle got you.  Neener neener neener.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Herb wants to see me?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: When you have a moment.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Mr. Massey --

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Please! No calls! I'm feeling very fragile.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Massey, but I felt certain you'd want to know -- Marylin Rexroth wants to see you.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Marylin Rexroth? When does she --

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: She's here now.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: So, Ruth. How's Sam?

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Sam is Sam. He's taking up fly fishing. He's in a yert in Montana.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: A yert.  Ruth is a living legend, Rex. At a time when most women are in Boca, having early bird specials -- she's working so her husband can be in Montana. In a yert.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Oh, just a routine mammogram. She said to say hello. She's going to Positano with your brother's family.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: So, Miles. If you have a proposal, let's hear it.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: At this point my client is still prepared to consider reconciliation.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: My client has ruled that out.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: My client is prepared to entertain an amicable dissolution of the marriage without prejudice.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: That's delusional.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: My client proposes a thirty day cooling off period.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: My client feels sufficiently dispassionate.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: My client asks that you not initiate proceedings pending his setting certain affairs in order.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Ha Ha.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Heh heh.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: -- So much for the icebreakers. What're you after, Ruth?

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: My client is prepared to settle for fifty percent of the marital assets.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Why only fifty percent, Ruth? Why not ask for a hundred percent?

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Oh brother. Here we go.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Why not a hundred and fifty percent?

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Yes. Maybe you're right, Miles. Maybe we're being too conservative. Seventy five percent.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Are you familiar with Kirshner?

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Kirshner does not apply. Kirshner was in Kentucky.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: ...arty farty!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Rephrase. Mrs. Rexroth, have you ever been in love?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: He divorced his wife -- he married Marylin -- he divorced Marylin -- and he -- remarried his WIFE? What kind of sick --

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Marylin was friends with Howard and Amanda Doyle. They don't like the way you operate. They helped her.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: He never ate the pre-nup, did he!

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: I have no idea what Howard Doyle eats. I'm not a damn dietician.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Did Marylin end up with money?

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: She's YOUR wife. Why don't you ask her? Anyway, I assume she signed the highly over rated Massey pre-nup.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I don't have a pre-nup

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: ...The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Don't give me that crap. That's MY crap.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: And it's good!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I'll have you suspended. I'll have you disbarred.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Don't threaten me, Miles. I did nothing illegal.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: ...why did she do it, Ruth? Why?

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: That's attorney client privilege.  Sorry, Miles. But as a great and clever man once said, What's good for the goose --

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Where does that leave us?

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: We've outlined a settlement...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Mr. Rexroth.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Rex, please.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Miles Massey. Please sit, relax, and consider this office your office, your haven, your war room -- for the duration of the campaign.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Now Rex.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: ...Well, my wife has me between a rock and a hard place.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: That's her job. You have to respect that.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: When I first met Marylin -- Well, we were crazy about each other. Not emotionally, of course. We just couldn't keep our hands off each other.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Mm.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: But then... But then...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Time marches on. Ardor cools.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: No. Not exactly. It didn't exactly cool. Marylin is a knock-out. And very sexy -- but -- there's a lot of it out there.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Ah.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: You know what I mean when I say "it."

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Gotcha. No need to get anatomically correct with me, Rex.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Seems like there's more of it than ever before --

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Well, with the expanding global population -- Let me ask you this -- your wife. Has she pursued the opportunities which must present themselves to the "knock-out, sexy woman" you described?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: I don't know. I can assume...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Not in court you can't. Has she retained counsel?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: And your wife is aware of or has evidence of your activities?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Video.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Mmm... And to cut to the chase, forensically speaking -- is there a pre-nup?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars, but in ourselves. Well, let me ask you this: what kind of settlement do you seek? What are, for you, the parameters of the possible?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: That's the problem. I can't afford to give her anything.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Nothing?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: I know that sounds rough but I'm about to close on a deal to develop some mini-malls, and I'm mortgaged up to my ass. If this deal goes south, I'm ruined -- I'll lose millions.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: So, you propose that in spite of demonstrable infidelity on your part, your unoffending wife should be tossed out on her ear?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Well -- is that possible?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: What's Kirshner?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Please -- let me handle this. Okay, Ruth, forget Kirshner -- what's your bottom line?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I think that went as well as could be expected.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: She always looked out for me.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: And she had private investigators assisting her.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: She brought my digestive enzymes.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: In anticipation of making you sick.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Maybe I should reconsider my...

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: Wait... He wants to give her...?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: And she has...?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Video.

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: What the fuck...?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Wrigley!

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Sometimes I have serious doubts about you.

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: I am very sorry.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Am I mentoring the wrong mentee?

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: No. You're not.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I could be mentoring Kramer. Kramer clerked for Scalia.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What the hell is wrong with you?

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: I can't help it. Even with the business we're in, I -- it gets me every time. It's so -- optimistic.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Is she going through with it?

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What are they?

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: Berry spoons.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Spoons! Honestly Wrigley, I'm surprised at you. What is this? Some Martha Stewart suggestion? Those are the most cockamamie things I've ever --

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: Miles -- why so angry?

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: I'm sorry I'm late. I was having lunch with Ruth Rabinow's assistant. Guess what? Marylin Rexroth is divorced!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: HA!

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: ...and I hear she's richer than Croesus.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Ah, but is she richer than Mrs. Croesus?

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: She could buy and sell you ten times over.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: She deserves every penny. They pay great athletes a fortune. Well, Marylin Rexroth is an athlete at the peak of her power.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Get me Marylin Rexroth Doyle.

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: What...?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: She owes me a meal.

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: I'd stay away from her, Miles.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I know you would, Wrigley. But would Kramer?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Wrigley?

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: Miles.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Kenneth this is my associate, Wrigley. Wrigley this is my friend, Dr. Beck.

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: The plastic surgeon! I read about you in LA Style.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Do you have it?

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: I tried to reach Ruth, but we couldn't get her.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: We wanted Ruth here for your protection as well --

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: The Judge is here. Over here, Judge Munson.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yes.  It's for your protection, sweetheart. You're the one with the -- the...

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: -- the coin?

turns.speaker: WRIGLEY
turns.text: Extinguish?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Should we counsel fear -- or trust? Should we seek to destroy -- or to build? Should we meet our clients' problems with cynicism -- or with love?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Now, Mrs. Banderas. What is your relationship to Mrs. Rexroth.

turns.speaker: PATRICIA
turns.text: We don't have much of a relationship anymore. I haven't seen her since before she married Rex. We had some very nice times prior to that. We were quite close.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: And how would you define your relationship to Mrs. Rexroth. You know -- you are her...?

turns.speaker: PATRICIA
turns.text: Mother?

turns.speaker: PATRICIA
turns.text: Hi, Sweetie.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Hard to believe I know. I'm sure you are frequently mistaken for sisters.

turns.speaker: PATRICIA
turns.text: No. I haven't. But I've been out of town.  Hello, Rex. Hello there.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You were never invited to meet your son-in-law?

turns.speaker: PATRICIA
turns.text: No. Uh uh. I don't think so. Hmm? No. Well... no.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Did you know Mrs. Rexroth was married?

turns.speaker: PATRICIA
turns.text: Of course. Of course she was married. What else would she be? Single? I don't think so.

turns.speaker: PATRICIA
turns.text: Let me tell you something about Patty.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Who's "Patty."

turns.speaker: PATRICIA
turns.text: Oh. That's her name. Patricia. Like mine. I was Pat and she was Patty. But she changed it after seeing "Some Like It Hot." To Marylin. After Marylin Monroe.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I see. And what were you going to tell us about Patty slash Marylin?

turns.speaker: PATRICIA
turns.text: When she was a tiny girl? And people asked her what she wanted to be when she grew up? She never said the usual things little girls say -- like -- nurse -- ballerina -- anchorwoman? She always said --  "When I grow up, I want to be divorced."

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Divorce was her childhood aspiration?

turns.speaker: PATRICIA
turns.text: Well, not just divorce. She used to say "I want to be divorced from some big dumb rich guy..." And I guess her dream is coming true.  I'm happy for you Patty

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: I've been trying to nail George's for years, but he's very careful. I'll just keep having children. I think I'm pregnant, by the way.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Ramona! Don't get Mia Farrow on us.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: Three is not Farrow.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Who's Rex's guy?

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: George was so impressed he hired him when he divorced his second.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Muriel Rumsey.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: It's not so bad these days. Kids like joint custody. Two sets of toys.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: Maybe next time.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: Thorstenson Gieselensen. He just separated from his third. He's in fish. He is fish.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: She's keeping his name. And one of his planes. And all seven of his children

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: And only two are hers.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: That doesn't make sense. It's like punishing you for being goal oriented.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Well, you can live here as long as you want. Do you have any plans?

turns.speaker: LOVINGTON
turns.text: We can't do the impossible, Mr. Andrews.

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: What I'm asking isn't impossible. My daughter is somewhere between here and Miami. I want her found!

turns.speaker: LOVINGTON
turns.text: I've put extra men on, all along the way.

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: It's not enough!  Are you certain she's not with King Westley?

turns.speaker: LOVINGTON
turns.text: No. He's been trailed twenty-four hours a day since this thing started. He can't even get a phone call we don't know about.

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: I'm worried, Lovington. After all, something might have happened to her.

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: OhMary

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Yes, sir?

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: How is she?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Whyuhshe's all right, sir.

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: What's the matter? Anything wrong?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Oh, no, sir. No different than

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: Yes. I know. Still in the dumps, huh?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Yes sir. If you'll excuse me, sirshe sent me for a drink.  Andrews stands a moment thoughtfully and then starts up the stairs, following which the scene dissolves to the UPSTAIRS CORRIDOR in front of Ellie's door. Andrews enters and knocks several times. Receiving no response, he gingerly opens the door.

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: Can't you get them to go any faster?  This dissolves to a deserted ROAD, Peter at the wheel of his car. His high spirits find expression in his efforts to sing.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: "I found a million dollar baby"

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yeah, but I don't like the idea of walking in on your jamboree . . . Just between you and methose things give me a stiff pain.

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: You needn't see anybody. You can come directly to my study. I'd appreciate it very much if

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Nono. What the deuce do I want to

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: Mr. Warne?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ANDREWS
turns.text: Come in. Sit down.
